Earnest.definition: something of value given by a buyer to a seller to bind a bargain
Earnest.origin: [Anglo-French ernes(t) erles , alteration of Old French erres , plural of erre pledge, earnest, alteration of Latin arra , short for arrabo , from Greek arrhab≈çn , of Semitic origin]

1.1: something of value given by a buyer to a seller to bind a bargain
